title: Need some kerning assistance
content:
Hey There,

Currently finishing off a logo design for the company I work for. This project has gone through a long and sometimes tedious process and at this point I’m having some trouble looking at it with the proper perspective.

There’s no room for major changes at this point, but I think I could use some fresh eyes to help me with the kerning of the letters.

Any help would be greatly appreciated.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202191625im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/logo_6147.jpg)

 [‹ Web Design company logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202191625/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34969 "Go to previous forum topic") [MAQ ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202191625/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35436 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Grok

comments.content: I think the kerning is pretty good. Maybe the space between the R and I could be a little bit smaller. But not needed per sé.

Just a little bit more space for me mate, let the letters breath, only slightly.  
All comes down to preference at this stage in a project.

Safe. :)
I’d also say an all-caps, heavy-stroke line needs more overall tracking.

I agree with the others - a tiny bit of overall tracking.  
Individual kerning is hard for me to determine on the computer screen ... and I don’t have a printer at the moment ... but it seems that you have done a fairly good job with the kerning.
Thanks for your input everyone. Much appreciated!
